intro: Zeugites haitiensis, commonly known as Haitian zeugite, is a rare flowering plant native to the island of Haiti. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers and hairy stems, adapted to the tropical climate of its native habitat. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils in open areas. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
